intro: Oldenlandia golungensis, commonly known as the golden crown vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oldenlandia golungensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
